com.pump.job

Interface JobManager.Listener

  • Enclosing class:
    JobManager

    public static interface JobManager.Listener
    This offers a model for simple notification of what this JobManager is currently doing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void jobAdded(JobManager manager, Job... job)
      This is called before a job begins executing.
      void jobError(JobManager manager, Job job, java.lang.Throwable t)
      This is called when an error occurs executing a job.
      void jobQueued(JobManager manager, Job... job)
      This is called when a job is added to the queue of pending jobs.
      void jobRemoved(JobManager manager, Job... job)
      This is called when a job finished executing.
      void jobSkipped(JobManager manager, Job... job)
      This is called when a job is skipped over, either because it was cancelled or because it was removed from the pending job queue in this manager.

    • Method Detail

      • jobError

        void jobError(JobManager manager,
              Job job,
              java.lang.Throwable t)
        This is called when an error occurs executing a job.

        This is probably invoked on a thread that executes jobs, so this should not perform EDT work and should probably be very light (triggering other threads if necessary).

      • jobAdded

        void jobAdded(JobManager manager,
              Job... job)
        This is called before a job begins executing. When this is invoked: the active job count of the JobManager will have changed.

        This is probably invoked on a thread that executes jobs, so this should not perform EDT work and should probably be very light (triggering other threads if necessary).

      • jobRemoved

        void jobRemoved(JobManager manager,
                Job... job)
        This is called when a job finished executing. When this is invoked: the active job count of the JobManager will have changed.

        This is probably invoked on a thread that executes jobs, so this should not perform EDT work and should probably be very light (triggering other threads if necessary).

      • jobSkipped

        void jobSkipped(JobManager manager,
                Job... job)
        This is called when a job is skipped over, either because it was cancelled or because it was removed from the pending job queue in this manager. When this is invoked: the pending count of the JobManager will have changed.

        This is probably invoked on a thread that executes jobs, so this should not perform EDT work and should probably be very light (triggering other threads if necessary).

      • jobQueued

        void jobQueued(JobManager manager,
               Job... job)
        This is called when a job is added to the queue of pending jobs. When this is invoked: the pending job count of the JobManager will have changed.

        This is probably invoked on the thread that added the job.
